body:
### Problem

When I use the volar langauge server with *hybrid mode* which need two language server(volar, tsserver) to be attacted current buf in vue  file, the method completion(`[].<C-x><C-o>`)  results by the `tsserver` in `<script>` are inserted at unexpected positions.(eg. `[]..concat` instead of `[].concat`)

*NOTE*
- volar is used for html and css, tsserver is used for js

*Gif*
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/306bd55e-6b92-4bb9-93d5-dd955ff7758d)




### Steps to reproduce

1. `npm install -g typescript typescript-language-server @vue/language-server`
2. `mkdir test && cd test && touch package.json app.vue`
3. `nvim -u test.lua app.vue`
4. type with `[].<C-x><C-o>` and select fist match result
5. get `[]..concat`

*./app.vue*
```vue
<script setup>
[].
</script>

<template>
</template>

<style scoped>
</style>
```

*./test.lua*
```lua
local ts_config = {
    name = 'lsp-ts',
    cmd = { 'typescript-language-server.cmd', '--stdio' },
    root_dir = vim.fs.root(0, { 'package.json' }),
    init_options = {
        plugins = {
            {
                name = '@vue/typescript-plugin',
                location = '/path/to/node_modules/@vue/language-server',
                languages = { 'vue' },
            }
        }
    }
}

local vue_config = {
    name = 'lsp-vue',
    cmd = { 'vue-language-server.cmd', '--stdio' },
    root_dir = vim.fs.root(0, { 'package.json' }),
    init_options = {
        vue = {
            hybridMode = true,
        },
        typescript = {
            tsdk = '/path/to/node_modules/typescript/lib'
        }
    }
}

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
    pattern = {
        'javascript', 'vue',
    },
    callback = function()
        vim.lsp.start(ts_config)
        vim.lsp.start(vue_config)
    end,
})
```

### Expected behavior

**Expected**
should get: `[].concat`

**Analyse**
 I have look into the source code which related with omnifunc. When trigger onmifunc with `<C-x><C-o>` , it will send completion requests to all servers attached to the current buffer.

For insert result, it insert all server response match result (even if empyt) into one match table.  (no problem)

For match result insertion postion, it relies two value which is  origin value `word_boundary` and  compueted value
`server_start_boundary`  which from **the last server response**. (`server_start_boundary` and `word_boundary` is the before insertion position) 

For the computed of `server_start_boundary`. Specificallyï¼Œfor **tsserver**, when type with  `[].<C-x><C-o>`, it will response with `.method` instead of `method`. So for fit with it, `item.textEdit.range.start` which the computed value `server_start_boundary` based on is **different from `word_boundary` or normal language server**.(for below, the before insertion position is  2 not 3)

```js
"rpc.reveive" {
  ...,
  result = {
    isIncomplete = false,
    items = {
      { 
        data = { cacheId = 1},
        filterText = ".concat",
        kind = 2,
        label = "at",
        textEdit = {
          newText = ".concat",
          range = {
            ["end"] = { character = 3, line = 2 },
            start = { character = 2, line = 2 } }
          }
       },
       ...
     },
     ...
   }
}
```

As above I said: "For match result insertion postion, it relies two value which is  origin value `word_boundary` and  compueted value
`server_start_boundary`  which from **the last server response**. " But, when the `server_start_boundary` which computed by last response is nil(for above demo, volar will give the empty `item`, because it only used for css or html instead of javascript), the before insertion position will be only `word_boundary`(it is 3). But the truly before insertion position is `server_start_boundary`(is 2) which `tsserver` given.


**Conclusion**
- This is not specify language server problem, it is code logic error.
- The before insertion position should not rely on the `server_start_boundary` **which from the last response**.

**Solution**
- See #31381 


### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1247+g5897994cb7

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

NA

### Operating system/version

Windows 11 professional 

### Terminal name/version

windows terminal 1.21.241118001

### $TERM environment variable

NA

### Installation

scoop
title: lsp: incorrect completion insertion position in some cases when buffer need to be attached on mulit-server
